definition: guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: At least the banks would not be holding the whole country hostage.
sentences.chinese: 至少银行就不能打着保家卫国的旗号，发国难财了。

sentences.english: Your charge now is not only to protect our country, but to do what is right and just.
sentences.chinese: 你们的使命不仅是保家卫国，更是伸张正义。

sentences.english: They made a promise to our country to be its defenders.
sentences.chinese: 他们在保家卫国上做出许诺。

sentences.english: Women now have the ability to fight crime and defend their countries in war.
sentences.chinese: 女性如今有能力打击犯罪，更能在战时保家卫国。

sentences.english: This is what the military leaders, charged with responsibility for our strategic  deterrent, need in order to defend our country.
sentences.chinese: 这是肩负战略威慑职责的军事领袖们保家卫国的需要。

sentences.english: His hearth difficult, Kings son and the son of the people also get on the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 保家卫国难啊，帝王之子和百姓之子也得上战场。

sentences.english: This is what the military leaders, charged with responsibility for our strategic deterrent, need in order to defend our country.
sentences.chinese: 这是肩负战略威慑职责的军事领袖们保家卫国的需要。

sentences.english: Historically kungfu was used to fight one's enemies and protect the homeland.
sentences.chinese: 历史上，功夫主要用来与敌人斗争，保家卫国。

sentences.english: They mold you for your future roles as the custodians of the Nation's defense.
sentences.chinese: 他们为了塑造你将来为保家卫国的守卫者角色。

definition: to defend one's country
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country
serviceman/soldier/military personnel
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to guard one's territory/to protect the country
to sacrifice one's life
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
to die in battle (idiom)
battlefield
to garrison the border/to guard the frontier/exile to a border garrison post
a (real) man/boy/son
to achieve or accomplish goals
to enlist/to serve in the army
to serve in the army/to be a soldier
to attack the enemy
to root out the strong and give people peace (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor
